text: Panama is divided into ten provinces (). There are three provincial-level indigenous regions (, often shortened to comarcas). In Panama, the comarca indígena is an administrative region for an area with a substantial indigenous population. There are also two indigenous comarcas within provinces that are considered equivalent to a corregimiento (municipality). == Provinces == ISO 3166-2 Province Capital Area (km2) Population (2010 census) Density (inh./km2) PA-1 Bocas del Toro Bocas del Toro PA-2 Coclé Penonomé PA-3 Colón Colón PA-4 Chiriquí David PA-5 Darién La Palma PA-6 Herrera Chitré PA-7 Los Santos Las Tablas PA-8 Panamá Panama City PA-9 Veraguas Santiago de Veraguas PA-10 Panamá Oeste La Chorrera Comarcas indígenas PA-EM Emberá Unión Chocó PA- KY Guna Yala El Porvenir PA-NB Ngäbe-Buglé Chichica ===Sub-Provinces=== Comarca Province Area (km2) Population (2010 census) Density (inh./km2) Guna de Madungandí Panamá Guna de Wargandí Darién == Related pages == *ISO 3166-2:PA == Notes == ==References==
title: Provinces of Panama
